svg.style: background: transparent; background-color: transparent; color-scheme: light dark;

ellipse.style: fill: light-dark(#ffffff, var(--ge-dark-color, #121212)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 388px; height: 1px; padding-top: 80px; margin-left: 721px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.p: ARP stands for Address Resolution Protocol. It's a fundamental networking protocol that acts as a "translator" between IP addresses (Layer 3, logical addressing for routing across networks) and MAC addresses (Layer 2, physical addressing for local delivery on a network segment).

switch.text: ARP stands for Address Resolution Protocol. It's a fundamental ne...

request/response requires both mac for communication with
device via source and destinaiton IP

div.p: A creates an ARP packet: "Who has IP 192.168.1.20? Tell 192.168.1.10."

switch.text: A creates an ARP packet: "Who has IP...

div.p: Encapsulates it in an Ethernet frame: Source MAC = A's MAC; Destination MAC = Broadcast (FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF—all 1s, floods the LAN).

div.p:
"IP 192.168.1.2 is at MAC 77:88:99:AA:BB:CC."
(Source: B's IP/MAC; Target: A's IP/MAC—no broadcast here for efficiency.)

div.p: 1. Every device on that LAN receives ARP packet.

switch.text: 1. Every device on that LAN receives ARP packet.

switch.text: 2. And on each device, every network interface receives it too...

div.p: Only the matching interface generates and sends the reply, using its own MAC address.

div.div: The OS simply discards/ignores the ARP request

div.div: When a broadcast ARP packet hits the local network, the Network Interface Card (NIC) on every device "hears" it because the destination MAC address is set to FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF (the universal "everyone" address)

switch.text: When a broadcast ARP packet hit...
